text.section:
The Program shall:
provide a prescription drug benefit subsidy, as determined by the Board, that may pay all or some of the deductibles, coinsurance payments, premiums, and copayments under the federal Medicare Part D Pharmaceutical Assistance Program for enrollees of the Program; and
provide the subsidy to the maximum number of individuals eligible for enrollment in the Program, subject to the moneys available in the segregated account under § 14-504 of this subtitle.

The Program may limit payment of any subsidy by paying the subsidy only on behalf of eligible individuals enrolled in a Medicare Part D Prescription Drug Plan or Medicare Advantage Plan that coordinates with the Program in accordance with federal requirements.

The Program:
may annually provide an additional subsidy, up to the full amount of the Medicare Part D Prescription Drug Plan premium, for individuals who qualify for a partial federal low-income subsidy; and
shall annually provide an additional subsidy up to the full amount of the Medicare Part D coverage gap, subject to the availability of:
funds provided under § 14-106.2 of this title; and
any other funds available for this purpose.
The Program shall maintain a waiting list of individuals who meet the eligibility requirements for the Program but who are not served by the Program due to funding limitations.

The Board shall determine annually:
the number of individuals to be enrolled in the Program;
the amount of subsidy to be provided under subsections (a) and (c)(2) of this section; and
the amount of any additional subsidy provided under subsection (c)(1) of this section.

On or before January 1 of each year, the Board, in accordance with § 2-1246 of the State Government Article, shall report to the General Assembly on:
the number of individuals on the waiting list for the Program; and
to the extent that the Board is able to collect the information:
the number of enrollees with out-of-pocket prescription drug costs that exceed $2,250, broken down for each fiscal quarter; and
the total annual out-of-pocket prescription drug costs for enrollees.
